page.title: 03LIVESTOCK HARDWICK AREA
page.content: 5 Farms breed pigs,mainly intensively, the weaners sold to be fattened.Entry is restricted.3 dairy herds keeping Jersey,Ayrshire & Friesian cows sell milk to the MMB in Norwich.Bulk tank lorries colllect daily.These small herds restricted by the EEC milk quota may only send their 1983 output.A former dairy farmer uses his milk to fatten calves.1 farmer fattens bulls of mixed breeds bought locally at 1wk, sold fat at 1 yr,&rears Hereford heifers for beef.There are 2 broilerhouse businesses where table fowl are reared intensively. Machinery; a 120 acre farmer milks 33 cows in a 100 yr old shed with an electronic system of pipeline to bulk tank.He owns a combine harvester,small baler,3 tractors,4 trailers,sprayer, hedge trimmer,fertilizer spreader,seed drill,hay mower & harrows.
